InputAttachmentSet Class Reference

#include <InputAttachmentSet.h>

List of all members.

Detailed Description

A set of keyboard, mouse, and joystick attachment valid for a given scene.

The global attachments are also formed as a special attachment set.

Author:
Thomas Jacob

Definition at line 23 of file InputAttachmentSet.h.

void attachJoystickXMove (  int  eventNumber,
long  factor
) 
 

Sets, that x movements of the joystick shall increase or decrease certain event quantities.

Parameters:
eventNumber The number of the event for the joystick x movement.
factor The amount to increase the x event quantity for each x step. This number may be negative.

long  factor
) 
 

Sets, that the x position of the joystick shall set certain event quantities.

Parameters:
eventNumber The number of the event for the joystick x position.
factor The multiplier for the x position. This number may be negative.

void attachKey (  int  eventNumber,
int  keyCode,
int  type,
long  factor
) 
 

Sets, that a keyboard key shall raise a certain event if pressed, released or held.

To raise an event means to increase its quantity by a certain amount.

Parameters:
eventNumber The number of the event.
keyCode The key code that raises the event. This may include joystick and mouse buttons, specified using the key constants (e.g. InputManager::joyButton1 or InputManager::leftMouseButton).
type The type of key action to raise the event. Possible values are:
  • GFKC_HOLD: The event is raised while the key is held by factor for each milli second.
  • GFKC_PRESS: The event is raised once when the key is pressed.
  • GFKC_PRESSREPEAT: The event is raised when the key is pressed, and when held according to keyboard repetition (KeyboardRepeatDelay, KeyboardRepeatRate).
  • GFKC_RELEASE: The event is raised once when the key is released.
  • GFKC_PRESSRELEASE: The event is raised once when the key is pressed and once when released.
factor The amount to increase the event quantity in case of an event. This number may be negative.

void attachMouseWheel (  int  eventNumber,
long  factor
) 
 

Sets, that the mouse wheel movement shall increase a certain event quantity.

Parameters:
eventNumber The number of the event for the mouse wheel movement.
factor The amount to increase the event quantity for each step. This number may be negative.

void attachMouseXMove (  int  eventNumber,
long  factor
) 
 

Sets, that the X movement of the mouse shall increase certain event quantities.

Parameters:
eventNumber The number of the event for the mouse movement.
factor The amount to increase the event quantity for each step. This number may be negative.

void attachMouseYMove (  int  eventNumber,
long  factor
) 
 

Sets, that the Y movement of the mouse shall increase certain event quantities.

Parameters:

factor The amount to increase the event quantity for each step. This number may be negative.

int getAttachmentKey (  int  eventNumber,
bool  positive = true,
bool  negative = true
) 
 

Returns the key code of the attachment of a given event number.

Parameters:
eventNumber The number of the event.
positive Whether to search for attachments with positive factor. Defaults to true. May be combined with negative.
negative Whether to search for attachments with positive factor. Defaults to true. May be combined with positive.
Returns:
The key code of the attachment found, or -1 if no attachment or more than one attachment was found. The key may include joystick and mouse buttons, specified by the key code constants (e.g. KEY_JOYSTICK_BUTTON1 or KEY_MOUSE_LEFT).
